newsitem.title: USA: High court denies appeal of gas gathering ruling.
newsitem.headline: High court denies appeal of gas gathering ruling.

text.p: The U.S. Supreme Court Tuesdsay denied an appeal by Amoco Corp unit Amoco Energy Trading Corp and other natural gas producers of a Federal Energy Regulatory Commission ruling that it had no jurisdiction to regulate rates that companies charge on gas gathering pipelines.
Gathering pipelines are used to ship natural gas from producing fields to interstate pipelines.
Producers wanted the FERC to make sure that no pipeline company could favor its producing affiliates over other producers in areas where it effectively controlled access to interstate pipelines.
But the FERC ruled in 1993 that states should regulate natural gas gathering because under federal law, the commission had no authority to do so.
Company officials, the attorney for the companies, and FERC officials familiar with the issue were unavailable for comment Tuesday on the Supreme Court's decision not to hear the case.
